website_summaries.verdict: This exceptionally-rated kit works wonders with its extra-long dressing stick and functional accessories.
pros: Dressing stick features unique "s"-shaped handle for ultimate dressing help
Accessories include a 32-inch magnetic reacher, a deluxe sock aid, a long sponge for bathing, and a shoe horn
cons: Many customers found the extra accessories were not as helpful as the dressing stick itself

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as original:(
customer_reviews.text: I have the same product from many yrs ago . Unfortunately the more recent product is made more poorly than the original. The shoe horn now is shorter (18”)and made of plastic; wheresas the orig was metal 24” long . THe grabber bar also is made more cheaply with Only ONE cord used to close the “mouth” and it no longer has round metal clip attached to the handle so u could hang it
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Must have for a hip replacement
customer_reviews.text: Getting ready to go in for a hip replacement. At our pre op class they mentioned a hip kit. Came home and ordered immediately. I live alone and this is a must have for getting dressed, undressed, picking things up. Has made my life easier. The reacher has a plastic clip on it that can be attached to my walker, that clip broke, Amazon sent me a new kit and soon as able, will return the other kit. This was an invaluable asset to me. Never would have gotten the compression socks on with it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much a waste of money. I had bilateral hip replacement surgery & bought this kit prior to surgery. The hospital provided most of these items of better quality. The only item I used was the scrubber & it wouldn't stay together. Check with hospital before buying. BTW, these grabbers suck! Get a Grip 'n Grab, available here. The Cadillac of grabbers, I've been using one to pick up fallen limbs & branches for years & it's still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Bordersnake

customer_reviews.title: Very useful post-surgery
customer_reviews.text: My wife had knee replacement surgery, and the physical therapist recommended a hip kit. This has been very helpful. The device for putting socks on is a much better design than others I’ve seen. She was even able to put on a tight compression garment with it. This design of reacher/grabber is easier to use than the kind with converging 'blades' or 'fingers' and is capable of picking up something as small as a dropped pill from the floor. We already had a foot lifting strap, but that is also pretty much essential for therapy, bending the leg in bed, etc. The six-piece version of this kit has one, plus the items here.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H

customer_reviews.title: All but one item is useful
customer_reviews.text: Everything works well except for the grabber. Only the yellow end of it moves up and down and the other side is in immovable. This is actually harder to use than other types of grabbers. I have been using my husbands (he has back problems) end it has both sides that moves with wider round grabbing surfaces it works so much easier than this one. This one also has the screw that sticks out on the end which is probably supposed to be useful and it gets in the way. Everything else in the package works really great and is very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: If you are alone, IT IS A MUST! If you have help (like spouse), not really necessary.
customer_reviews.text: My wife had hip replacement 2 weeks ago, i have been home for the 1st 2 weeks, we haven't used this at all. I could see the long shoe horn helping her once i go back to work, and maybe sock helper. Also, we are young hip patients, 56, so we're recovering nice and fast. She is already able to put shoes on, can't tie yet though. I could see this being helpful though, in certain situations where home help is limited. It probably takes practice to learn to use some of this. Things seem to be made well. OVERALL,....???????? we didn't really need this product, just went on Hospitals Recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny H.

customer_reviews.title: Grabber is junk
customer_reviews.text: Grabber tool (most necessary item in the kit for me) is a piece of junk. See the little string that forms a triangle at the base of the jaws? That's what it is, a piece of string, as opposed to the steel cables that operate the jaws in other manufacturers' comparably priced grabbers. Guaranteed not to last.
customer_reviews.author: I. Bloch

customer_reviews.title: Not just for hips or knees, works for back surgery too!  As always check with your doctor first...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gift for someone who just had back surgery! We didn't know there were kits like this available until I went to PT in rehab. My wife was with me and started looking for things on Amazon as the therapist was talking. She found this, ordered it and we had it in two days. This is back surgery #5 for me and so far has been the most painful. This kit has been a lifesaver and given me some independence back. Thank you Jeanne for getting me this kit and thank you RMS for having such an awesome kit available for people like me!
customer_reviews.author: TheFoods

customer_reviews.title: Invaluable Tools
customer_reviews.text: Very useful set of tools to use after hip replacement surgery. The dressing stick has been terrific, and I've appreciated being able to get dressed/undressed without asking for someone to help. The sock tool is fabulous and I wish I'd had it a couple years ago when my hip started going bad. THe reacher is definitely light duty, but great for picking up items of clothing and tissues, and is precise enough that I could pick up a small pill that I dropped. I'd highly recommend this set to anyone who needs a little assistance with dressing, bathing and picking things up.
customer_reviews.author: CJH

customer_reviews.title: I am having my right hip replaced and this whole ...
customer_reviews.text: I am having my right hip replaced and this whole package is worthy or the purchase,,,,the sock helper is worth it alone....I used to wake up early last hunting season just to spend 15 minutes trying to put on my two pair of hunting socks. If I have this helper it would have been a breeze. You will need off the this stuff if a knee replacement is on the horizon as well....
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit while recovering from hip surgery and found most of the pieces very helpful, especially the grabber, the hooked stick, and the sock puller. THe long handled sponge also came in very handy. The long plastic shoe horn wasn't really sturdy enough to help me put on my shoes, but on the whole, I was well satisfied with this kit. It helped me to independently function after surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Barb Scott

customer_reviews.title: Not entirely useful to women for dressing
customer_reviews.text: Sock aid useless and destroys smaller (a.k.a., women's) socks, the dressing aid hook good only for pulling up sweats, with great maneuvering,. Useless with pants unless they're equally loose/stretchy. Basically, I think this kit is designed for, and tested only by men. Except for body brush, which I haven't tried (surgery not for a couple of weeks) and grabber (which has its limitations) I suspect this kit more useful to men.
customer_reviews.author: madnatter

customer_reviews.title: Very useful, but could use some improvements
customer_reviews.text: Users, take note: the sock puller isn't nearly as intuitive as the lack of instructions would suggest. After weeks of using the device, I finally realized that the puller works better when the heel of the sock has been pulled onto the device as well. Best results were achieved by bunching the toe of your sock at the end of the scoop, then pulling. Further, the lengths of the clothing puller and the reacher make them impractical for use outside of the home. Telescoping handles would make each of these items packable for travel. Further, the reacher should be devised for collapsed hands-free carrying, perhaps hanging from a belt loop.
customer_reviews.author: Philo Yeager

customer_reviews.title: Everything You Need for one low price
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my purchase. The reacher is excellent. The gripping part is hard rubber, not plastic. I can pick up extension cords from the floor and trash & stuff, plus it pulls on underwear and pants and shoes. The dowel also added me in putting on Teva sandals. The sponge works well but I wish the handle was stiffer. The shoe horn will come in handy this Fall. The only thing of no use is the hard plastic sock helper. The hospital uses much better ones. Ones that are softer and fold around your foot. The hospital gift shop sold only 3 of these items and it would have cost more.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl57

customer_reviews.title: Essential!
customer_reviews.text: This kit was absolutely essential after my third hip surgery. I couldn’t bend so almost every piece was used regularly. I especially used the sock assist, stick with the hooks for shoes, and the grabber. I also bought a separate razor extender that was also essential. I’d definitely recommend this and would buy it again if I had another surgery and lost any part of this.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Fuqua

customer_reviews.title: This kit gives you the independence you crave - right after your hip replacement!
customer_reviews.text: The hook, grabber, sock tool and shoe horn give you the ability to dress yourself without breaking the rules your doctor gave you. It's so nice to not have to keep asking for help. Take the grabber with you - it's great for picking up those things you drop or the newspaper off the front drive. The sponge on a stick was not as useful because it was difficult to get a lather on the sponge. Get this kit before your surgery and you'll be all set!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen MPet

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at the recommendation of my doctor. What a lifesaver! All items are easy to use and provide me with independence. I am able to dress on my own using the dressing stick, shoehorn, and sock tool. And the grabber has come in handy several times. It’s a very sturdy and precise. I’ve picked up a small pill and small pieces of popcorn and also a cordless phone! If you’re having a hip replacement, you can’t do without the hip kit! (Get the one with the dressing stick. I think there is one without it...you’ll be sorry if you purchase that one.)
customer_reviews.author: Red onion

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful--especially the grabber!
customer_reviews.text: Recently had back surgery, so I needed to have all this stuff to get along as I heal. I use the grabber tool constantly, and will probably keep using it long after I heal. I've also used the long handled sponge. Very useful in the shower. Haven't used the sock thing or the dressing stick (couldn't figure that out). I donated those both to the Lions Club in town. They collect and rent out medical equipment for free. I'm keeping the long shoe horn for winter when I'll be out of sandals and into shoes. I might find it useful. But, I love my grabber! This is a nice kit for anyone facing surgery or as we get older.
customer_reviews.author: MsPea

customer_reviews.title: They are not super sturdy but then they should not have to function ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a well thought set of tools. They are not super sturdy but then they should not have to function beyond a couple of weeks. The grabber tool and the leg lift are life savers. The leg lift especially can reduce painful post-op trauma, you will find that just lifting your leg up and flopping it into your bed, your recliner, onto a footstool and the like is painful and practically impossible for a while. If you are having this surgery or know someone will this set of tools is worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: SanNel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this system mainly because of the sturdy grabber bar and the additional items were a bonus. My father purchased this same grabber bar many years ago (we will have that one) and needed an additional one in the house. The handle is easy to squeeze, the bar is long enough for most needs and the grip is sure. It is an excellent quality for the price and I can say from the original first purchase... they last a LONG time. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Depends on . . .
customer_reviews.text: Quality is marginal, maybe for the price? But if you don’t need all the devices in this kit it may not be worth buying the entire package. Shoehorn is plastic and susceptible to breaking. Maybe for the extension grabber the Walmart single item would be better? The coat hanger hook on the end of the stick to help remove socks bend far to easily. Not sure what the puffball on the end of the stick is good for?
customer_reviews.author: Careful Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must have for hip replacement surgery
customer_reviews.text: My husband had right hip replaced. Now we had some of the items, but decided to order the full kit. We are so glad we did. He would be lost without the pole with the hook and the "good grabber". You don't realize you need all these things until you have the surgery..... Very, very helpful!!! The sponge for the shower will be great. Have not tried the sock thing yet, but think it will be an asset also. I am his caretaker BUT this kit helps him do things for himself, so it helps both of us. Do not hesitate to get!!
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: Better used for knee replacement
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my hip replacement surgery rehab but ended up not even opening the bag and sending it back for a refund. Maybe it's better used during knee replacement rehab/recovery b/c that is way tougher and a lot longer. I've gone thru that and it's definitely not easy. Everything that's included could be very useful if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Zaftig227

customer_reviews.title: Useful (mostly)
customer_reviews.text: Great help after my hip surgery especially the picker-upper stick and the gadget to help you put your sock or stockings on! I assume the sponge would be useful for people who don't have a long handled brush. I have one so I never used it. As for the third stick I have no idea what it was for so I never used it.
customer_reviews.author: GitKash

customer_reviews.title: Great Help after Surgery
customer_reviews.text: The kit had some very helpful items. The shoe horn was great for getting my sneakers on - especially as I was not to bend more than 90 degrees. The grabber was longer than others and helped reach items easlity. The sock helper was also quite handy for getting socks up on the foot and ankle. Would definitely recommend this kit. The physical therapist at the hospital told me about the kit
customer_reviews.author: Elfin

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I had knee replacement surgery and they recommended ordering a "kit" like this so I did. What a waste of money. Not a single thing here is useful. It's all cheaply made. The long shoe horn is too flimsy to help get a shoe on. The sponge on a stick is just useless. The grabber doesn't grab enough to actually pick up anything but a small towel. You have to hold the "trigger" the whole time you're trying to grab something. You can buy better designed grabbers for a lot less. There are no instructions included on how to use this stuff. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: stm

customer_reviews.title: Helped after hip replacement
customer_reviews.text: I found the sock tool to be the item I used the most and for the longest. The sponge was kinda lame. The rest of the items were handy. I still use the shoe horn a year later. This was a great thing to have after the surgery. The dressing stick is quite clever and had a magnet to pick metal things up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must Have Tools - Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I underwent hip replacement surgery Dec 26th., and this product performed as advertised. It is well designed, constructed, and easy to use. I surprise myself discovering a different application to each tool to make any dressing operation easy. This must be because there are no instructions that came with the package so it feels like discovery operation. I recommend this product to anyone who has physical limitations getting dressed..
customer_reviews.author: Adrian07

customer_reviews.title: This is a useful set of tools to have after a hip
customer_reviews.text: This is a useful set of tools to have after a hip, back or knee surgery. However, the items in the kit are made for an average sized person. I am 6'4" and slightly over 300 pounds. The sock helper, for instance, is not wide enough for me to put my foot into and to use it. I have a small shower that I use and the handle on the bathing sponge will not maneuver around in the tight space well. But that is my issue, however, I would assume that the sock aid would come in different sizes for larger size people.
customer_reviews.author: Richard O'Dell

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: All these pieces were cheap quality, I ended up going to CVS to replace these pieces individually with better quality. Sponge stick broke at the first use, the sponge is cheaply glued onto the stick. Everything else still works but isn’t made of quality. You’re better off buying them individually.
customer_reviews.author: lonnie

customer_reviews.title: Great set of tools for anyone having total hip replacement. Affordable and so essential!
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect kit for me after my second total hip replacement. In the first two weeks, it was particularly helpful so that I could mostly dress myself and grab things I needed. I even used the grabber tool to adjust the covers at night. The only part of the kit that I haven’t used yet is the long scrubber sponge but I’ll try that soon. The sock tool has been really helpful for me to get the compression socks on with less effort. They can be a big challenge to take on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Sheltie Mom

customer_reviews.title: Worked Well
customer_reviews.text: This hip replacement kit had everything I needed to help me with the recovery. It was less expensive to buy through amazon so I did. The only thing I did not like was the extended sponge. It did not work well because it was kind of flimsy. Did not scrub really well but OK for temporary use. The rest of the kit worked well, just like they offer in the hospital.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Zee

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and on the cheap side
customer_reviews.text: This was a disappointing set. Most of the items are too flimsy to use and only lasted a few uses before I just tossed them out. The only items I still use after 1 year are the shoe horn and the grabber, and the grabber isn't really all that reliable. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TLW

customer_reviews.title: great collection of much needed tools for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after major back surgery and have used every piece but the shoe horn, which I expect to use when I start wearing hard shoes again. Great grabber, sock loader fits even my size 13 feet once you figure out how to make it work best. Clothes hook and shower sponge help you get to places you can't reach without bending. Shoehorn great for shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I Had Back Surgery And Sacroiliac Bilateral Surgery At The Same Time. Before I Had Gotten These Free From Hospital In The Past But This Time Nothing. So I Ordered These. They Are Great And Have Helped In My Time Of Need. Recommendable .
customer_reviews.author: lettie

customer_reviews.title: So helpful
customer_reviews.text: I originally was going to order these items separately for my father after his back surgery. I was so happy to find this in a bundle. Not only was it everything he needed I didn't have to search for a million things. He loves that he can attach the grabber to his walker. That was very smart. I would recommend this kit if you are looking for easy, affordable products after a surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: ok for price
customer_reviews.text: Kit was priced well for what's included and shipped in reasonable time. The grabber and the bath mitt are both very cheaply made. If you are looking for items to use past a few weeks of surgery recovery, look elsewhere. Probably 'ok' for temp use. The other items seem well made. This is literally a 'you get what you pay for' situation.
customer_reviews.author: LoveAK

customer_reviews.title: Regained My independence With This Kit
customer_reviews.text: This kit gave me the independence I needed after my surgery. I couldn't bend from the waist or use one of my legs so putting on and taking off my socks and reaching for things that fell (I'm really clumsy)was so much easier. The shoe horn bent when tried using it the first time which was disappointing but it didn't really bother me because i was home anyway. I never really used the sponge but the grabber made it all worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I wish that I would of had this when I first had the replacement done, the hook helps for taking off socks, the sponge is nice for showering, the pick up tool works well, the shoe horn is a shoe horn but the length is benificial. The sock assistant gives me great help with compression socks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes daily tasks easier and independence faster.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure that I would need everything in this kit when I purchased it. When I got home after surgery I was so glad I had all five items in the kit. I had struggled to dress even before surgery but the long dressing stick now made it a breeze. I'm tall and the shoe horn was just the right length. I already had a long handled sponge for bathing so I used the one in the kit for applying lotion. The long handled grabber is light weight and easy to use. The sock aid makes getting my socks and footies on so easy. I use all five items every day. They've made it much easier to be independent.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie D.

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful for many people - not only for hip or knee replacement
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my father who has Parkinson's disease, and he found it to be very helpful for maintaining his independence and self dignity. My husband, who uses a wheelchair, uses the "grabber" all the time to reach things high and low. My only suggestion would be to change the title of Hip Knee Replacement Kit to something more inclusive.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: The five piece knee/hip replacement kit was very useful and made getting dressed very easy
customer_reviews.text: The five piece knee/hip replacement kit was very useful and made getting dressed very easy. I would recommend the purchase of the kit to anyone receiving knee/hip replacement surgery. Even after recovery the tools can be used to reach items with the grabber, assist in the putting on of ones socks, and putting on or taking off socks, underwear, and various articles of clothing. A great buy and made my recovery so much easier and I was able to be more independent.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Rodani

customer_reviews.title: This product is garbage
customer_reviews.text: It is all junk the sponge extension broke already as did the shoe horn The sock thing is impossible to use and claw pick up extension string has come undone This garbage I’ve already complained to the hospital physical therapy department for recommending it. You should be ashamed for charging as much as you did. This is dollar store throw away garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Garcia

customer_reviews.title: The other thing that is good in this kit is the dressing stick
customer_reviews.text: The sock contraption is too large for women women socks. The grabber is not very functional. The other thing that is good in this kit is the dressing stick....a day my cats got more use of of it that I did. We've repurposed it as the cat scratching stick. All and all I would not recommend this kit. The contraptions are poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: meow

customer_reviews.title: The grabby stick is indispensable!  All useful items after fusion surgery.
customer_reviews.text: All these products were great and helpful after spinal surgery- the weak link was the bath sponge. Overly soft didn’t feel like it was doing anything, I enjoy a firmer scrub. But using it for in shower lotion application The grabby stick is a life saver for anyone who can’t bend after surgery. I use it daily!
customer_reviews.author: Mama P

customer_reviews.title: Daily activity aids
customer_reviews.text: I was introduced to a similar product line a few days ago while attending to my Father In the hospital as he was recovering from broken bone surgery. He was able to use the hospital version which made certain “activities of daily life” much easier. This group of products as mentioned is very similar and reduces the amount of pain associated daily normal activities. Paid extra for the speedier delivery that proved very timely. This product is highly recommended for those with leg/hip compromises.
customer_reviews.author: DocNaBox55

customer_reviews.title: Only works with very narrow foot
customer_reviews.text: Unless you have a very very narrow foot the sock starter is completely useless. I had a knee replacement and found the rest of the stuff in the package to be of no use. Total waste of money for my application
customer_reviews.author: Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Great tools for anyone
customer_reviews.text: Great basic tools for anyone who needs a little extra help. When my father-in-law broke his arm he struggled with getting his socks on and his OT recommended this. These tools have been invaluable. He will use them once he is healed as well. Highly recommended for anyone who is older, has arthritis, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa L.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: I havent had surgery yet but pre-op class showed how to use them and the cost for insurance was almost dbl from Amazon. This is why I ordered thru Amazon.The sock aid IS FANTASTIC it has been a struggle to put socks on and this is a blessing. the reach rod is great helps with clothes and the grabber I use for higher objects.You ont be disappointed is the quality or usage. Worth every cent ! !
customer_reviews.author: pat

customer_reviews.title: Little Miracle Workers
customer_reviews.text: Just had a complete knee replacement in exactly 1 week ago. With these tools I am able to put my own socks on, change my own clothes, reach for and pick up items that I have dropped, and for someone only one week out from knee surgery, that is just an awesome feeling.
customer_reviews.author: Lenore DeLude

customer_reviews.title: Important items to have on hand after hip replacement surgery
customer_reviews.text: This hip kit is recommended post-surgery to assist someone with activities they can't or shouldn't do in the post-op recovery period. The items are all useful in different ways and give recovering patients some additional ability to do things they couldn't do otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Affinity

customer_reviews.title: It works, but could be better
customer_reviews.text: This has everything I need while recuperating from back surgery. It all works fairly well. The sponge on a stick does not work for washing the back because of lack of flexibility, but works well for washing the feet. The grabber in the set works but is a little too long, and unwieldy to use. I prefer my old shorter on.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customert

customer_reviews.title: Some Parts very helpful
customer_reviews.text: Bought this kit prior to my hip replacement surgery. So far I have found the grabber indispensable. The thing for the sock is hard to use to put on the compression socks, it is difficult to get sock up over the foam pad and was unable to use it at all. The sock thing is probably fine for regular socks. Haven't used any of the other items
customer_reviews.author: Inky's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good value and handy
customer_reviews.text: It was still cheaper than the medical arcade. The sock tube is for smaller fee and my size 14's wouldn't even come close. The sponge wand was ok but couldn't put much pressure on it. Still I used it. The other three pieces I'm still using after 2 months out of knee surgery. They are just handy dohickeys.
customer_reviews.author: True Review 23

customer_reviews.title: weak materials --- 1 of the MOST USEFUL ITEMS BROKE AFTER 2 USES
customer_reviews.text: The products are poorly constructed of cheap, weak materials --- 1 of the MOST USEFUL ITEM BROKE AFTER 2 USES!!! The "Dressing Stick" dressing end cracked in the weak wood & plastic --- I am awaiting surgery & a lot weaker that normal & it broke with barely any pressure trying to get dressed. Overall package price and other items sort of make up for the loss, but I will definitely be getting a quality dressing stick from another manufacturer --- you'll see.
customer_reviews.author: Erik S

customer_reviews.title: Helpful but picker-upper is flimsey
customer_reviews.text: I just returned from posterior hip surgery and there are many rules. Your products are really helpful. I think the picker-upper needs to be more sturdy and tho its great it can clip onto the walker to take with you as you walk thru the house it seems to loosen up and fall down often when walking around. Otherwise it is very helpful. Picker-upper is good for clother or light objects like wash cloths and hands towels. but flimsey in picking up boxes of cereal or other food items. I had to get the "grabber" in Home Dept for the heavier items.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: All Good
customer_reviews.text: Using all but the sock wearing device (it is useless for me as it doesn't work with the socks I wear and assumes either non-elastic socks or women's socks rather than a basic mens athletic or dress sock that it won't fit). No breakage or problems otherwise to date.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't get through this without the grabber!
customer_reviews.text: Fortunately, my husband is providing me with full time care. Yet there are times when he has to go shopping or run other errands. It seems I drop something or need to reach something each time he is other wise occupied. I am amazed what I can actually pick up with the long handled grabber. All the other pieces seem to be as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good
customer_reviews.text: I really used and still use many of these gadgets. The only one I don't care for was the sponge. The grabber could be better but it is better than nothing. You need this if you are having hip surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Meribelle

customer_reviews.title: For the hipster-to-be...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much every tool that's indispensable for those who are having (or just had) a hip transplant. Something to help you pick up your socks without dislocating your hip (Take it from me; you definitely do NOT want to do that!), a handy device to help you slide them over your foot on the operated leg, the perfect shoehorn, long-handled bath sponge, and a garment hook. They will become your best friends during your rehab and recovery. They work fine, great price, good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Steve

customer_reviews.title: You need tools after a hip surgery!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mom after her hip surgery. She didn't use the sponge on a stick, but everything else was very useful. She told me it made a huge difference. She used the dressing stick for months, because socks and pants are very hard to get on and off. I HIGHLY recommend this kit for people going for a hip surgery. My mom told me this kit was better than the one at the hospital.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelin Gurung

customer_reviews.title: Had fractured hip, great product
customer_reviews.text: Had a fractured hip, Nurse recommend that I look at it as it would help me be more independent. I can get things like pants, socks to get dressed, cam grab. the sock thingy is a little more challenging. But all in all it is great.
customer_reviews.author: PN

customer_reviews.title: Most Helpful In Post Recovery
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad to have these very helpful tools as I recover from knee surgery. The long shoe horn is so wonderful my wife wants it after I'm done! The sock sleave is slick though since there were no instructions I found out through trial and error to put the plastic on the bottom. Also without instructions, I'm not sure how to use the stick with the coat hanger device. The lack of instructions is why I deducted one star.
customer_reviews.author: Steven L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: The Getter is quite amazing in that it picks up really small items
customer_reviews.text: After my recent total hip replacement surgery of the 5-piece kit, I used 2 items all the time. The dressing stick to assist in putting on clothes and the Reacher or "Getter", which I still use. The Getter is quite amazing in that it picks up really small items, like a dime and all sorts of dropped items.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: A must have for a total hip replacement!!
customer_reviews.text: A must have for a total hip replacement!! Could not do it without the reacher, dresser stick, shoe horn and sponge. Sock item-did not use. HOT where I live and went without. The only issue I have, is the dresser stick ends which are screwed in, seem to be stripped. All said, I highly recommend,
customer_reviews.author: Edward C.

customer_reviews.title: USED PRE- and POST HIP  SURGERY
customer_reviews.text: I can't imagine life without the sock puller. It's been a life changer and saver for me, allowing me to get dressed and continue to work independently. The bathing sponge is wimpy and useless. I found a gripper/grabber tool on Amazon I like better, but the one in this kit is definitely useful. I use the pole with the hook to get socks off and it work wonderful for that.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Olszak

customer_reviews.title: Helpful Kit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit on a recommendation from a friend who bought it before hip replacement surgery. I would have liked some instructions and/or pictures with the kit, especially the sock aid. My therapist showed me how to use the sock aid.The reaching stick and grabbers I use many times a day. The long handled bath sponge is not long enough. If you are going to have hip replacement surgery, you need to get the leg lifter, which is sold separately. All of these items will make you more independent. I would highly recumbent this kit plus the leg lifter.
customer_reviews.author: EA

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Everything that came in this pack works great,as a person that helps an elderly person i can tell you it's items work well especially the sock helper..would reccomend for an elderly person that needs asstence with dressing and bending over.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Good for the old hip.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this kit for my hip replacement surgery. The different tools have been very helpful in building my confidence. I would suggest it’s use for anyone after this type of surgery. The kit comes in different number of tools, per kit.
customer_reviews.author: V Bard

customer_reviews.title: A must-have after Total hip or knee surgery
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the kit to assist me with my second total hip replacement. I didn't know there was such a kit for my first THR. What a difference!! I could do things for myself safely with the help of the kit. Oh and what a wonderful surprise when I discovered I could use the sock tool to put on my compression hose!! I could dress myself and retrieve items dropped that any other way I wouldn't have been able to reach. I would tell anyone having surgery or limited ROM to do themselves a favor and try it out!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sock Aid WAY TO BIG. Useless.
customer_reviews.text: Sock Aid WAY too Big. Even my loosest socks won't squeeze onto sock aid. And can't adjust sock aid, plastic is too rigid and thick. Wear size women's 6 1/2 shoes, size 6-8 socks. Using horn, grabber, good. Pre- hip joint replacement, so significant pain and limited mobility. Practicing with other tools. Will use after surgery in couple weeks, but need sock aid now! Am now forced to shop for sock aid locally.
customer_reviews.author: msb

customer_reviews.title: Has everything you need and is very sturdy !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this right before surgery and took to my first presurgery class. The instructor loved everything about this package and had me send her the information about it to share with future hip replacement patients. The teacher is amazing and can even pick up a quarter on the ground with the grab fingers! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Gifted for upcoming hip replacement. Seems to be just what my friend wanted & to purchase as a bundle made since. She says they are quality items And a good lengh.
customer_reviews.author: Brett B.

customer_reviews.title: Vendor made good
customer_reviews.text: Opened but unused product. I had hip re-placement on October 24th, 2017 and then found this product very ineffective. The sock sleeve is not strong enough to pull on support socks, The retrieving rod is too weak to hold much weight. Had to order early so I had it on hand and then in the early stages of the recovery process is when I found the product to be substandard. Wanted to return it but missed the return date by 8 days. HOWEVER, vendor stepped up and made a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Rabbits Galore

customer_reviews.title: I need a new yellow clip for pick up tool
customer_reviews.text: All works good, but yellow clip on pick up tool did not always hold & after it falling off of my Walker & Cane multiple times for 2 months the yellow clip broke. I’m trying to find another yellow clip
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great help!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom after her hip replacement- it definitely helped with transition of her going home and giving her independence again.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri H

customer_reviews.title: Useful Kit
customer_reviews.text: Hip surgery is scheduled for next week but I’ve tried out each of the parts and they’re great. Also showed to therapist at hospital and she approved it!
customer_reviews.author: anne4491

customer_reviews.title: Great tools for someone who had hip surgery and have difficulty dressing yourself.
customer_reviews.text: Had hip surgery and couldn’t have gotten dressed without these tools. These tools made it easier for me then having to rely on someone else to help me get dressed.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: After surgery/disability helpers
customer_reviews.text: First the characteristics set in this review do not apply in judging these helpers. I have used each one and appreciate 4 out of the 5 items. Love the sock helper! Had hip replacement and these are must haves.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Kent

customer_reviews.title: Not well made.
customer_reviews.text: After a week of normal use, a black bar, probably meant to stabilize the grabber, fell out of my grabber. Fortunately, I was able to retrieve it and put it back in. However, these tools are supposed to help a person who had recent surgery or a disabled person live an independent life. Not everyone would have been able to “fix” this problem by themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: This set is great for someone who is needing extra help dressing, bathing, picking up things dropped out of reach. I didn’t have a hip or knee replacement, but I have muscle loss and I found everything useful .
customer_reviews.author: Jillian M

customer_reviews.title: Must have kit for any hip patient
customer_reviews.text: This kit is a MUST! I had major hip surgery and have used every product in this kit. My only complaint is I feel it should have also included the leg lift that helps you get in and out of vehicles or bed, etc. where you cannot lift your leg easily. Other than that it has worked well. I need to find just the bath sponge on a stick as it is time to replace it!
customer_reviews.author: MooMackMom

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for a family member who had hip surgery. It worked well and we used it all with the exception of the device to help with socks. It only works with regular socks not the compression you are asked to wear after surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great tools for those of us who have a disability
customer_reviews.text: I learned about the "dressing stick" and "sock helper" when I was in physical therapy. These aids, plus others, that are helpful to those of us with disabilities that make it difficult for us to bend over are included in this kit.
customer_reviews.author: Coconut Queen

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful aids while recovering from surgery!
customer_reviews.text: This hip kit was a lifesaver! I have used every piece during my recovery. My surgeon did an anterior approach full hip replacement, and the tools in this kit have helped me follow the precautions he gave. The grabber will pick up even tiny objects. My OT taught me to use the sock aid to put on even compression socks by myself. I’m well on my way to recovery, but will keep it together to pass on to friends who may benefit in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Debra K

customer_reviews.title: It needs a size range.
customer_reviews.text: The getter falls off the walker. The sox helper is way too large for a women's sox. The clothes helper if pretty goo but it has a hook on the end that grabs things and puts things on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Jolly Sims

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful for Recovery From Surgery
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my sister who had a hip replacement. Because she did not have very good range of motion, she was very pleased to use this kit. Without this kit, you run the risk of placing damage on your body. I would recommend you buy it because most post-op hospitals recommend it but they do not provide it.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Great tools for independence and recovery
customer_reviews.text: I have used each of the five items daily since my hip replacement. I wasn't sure if I would need them, but they have made it possible to do simple tasks independently. There will be uses for some of them following recovery with everyday living.
customer_reviews.author: Dirt Guy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: The products in this package are fantastic. I use everyone of them on a daily basis. It's a win for me to be able to put my own socks on again. The teachers and dressing tool come in handy all the time. The sponge brush works great to reach my back legs and feet. Keep up the good work. I think I will be ordering some more teachers because people keep borrowing mine. (Mom) lol
customer_reviews.author: Marty jaeger

customer_reviews.title: Hip Kit
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this because the PT suggested it, but have not really found most of the kit helpful. The long shoe Horn is helpful. I can see how the sock applicator could be useful if no one was available to assist the patient, also true for the grabber.
customer_reviews.author: cg

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended foe knee surgery patients
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a total knee replacement and could not be happier. I used everything in the package except for the shoe horn and as I live alone, I would have been LOST without this equipment. It was recommended in my joint academy class pre op and I’m glad I listened. Quality is okay, the sponge for bathing is a bit cheap and may not last much longer, but I won’t be needing it forever so this is not too big an issue.
customer_reviews.author: S. Tebes

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: These tools allowed me to come home after surgery. Able to dress myself, reacher awesome. Love shoe horn. Great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Antyan

customer_reviews.title: Very useful hip kit.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second hip replacement. The last one was about 15 years ago on the other side. This kit has a couple of extra things that the last one did not have and I think they are really going to come in handy. It arrived on time as promised and in very good condition.
customer_reviews.author: F. Rountree

customer_reviews.title: A must-have following hip replacement
customer_reviews.text: I found the sock-aid and the rod with the hook on the end to be essential for helping me get dressed after hip replacement surgery. There are limits to how far you can bend and reach, and these two items helped me function on my own. Didn't need the other pieces, but what was great was how quickly this was delivered. I ordered from the hospital and it was there when I got home 2 days later!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Katie

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I had back surgery. Everything in this kit worked well. The grabber will pick up anything that isn't too heavy. I couldn't bend to get my sock on, once you get the hang of it, it's a godsend. The long shoehorn was perfect height. Would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: we found your bundled product and we couldn’t be happier. Awesome purchase and products
customer_reviews.text: Recently, my dad fell and broke his hip. He went into rehab and used all these new tools during his stay that helped him maintain his independence while recouperating. When he came home he found he still needed them, we found your bundled product and we couldn’t be happier. Awesome purchase and products! Thank you
customer_reviews.author: nargo

customer_reviews.title: Loved 4 out of 5 of these items.
customer_reviews.text: These tools are super helpful following hip replacement surgery. My only negative comment is that the long handled sponge has a very slippery handle and I frequently dropped it in the shower. A better design would be to have a nonslip handle or a loop that someone could slip around their wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Adler

customer_reviews.title: Products are helpful but no instructions
customer_reviews.text: I am undergoing physical therapy for my right hip and range of motion is limited. The products did not come with any instructions except the one to assist with putting on socks or stockings. I had to figure out how to best use them. The shoe horn was easy but the other two were not so easy to know how to use.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Cheap garbage. Spring for a better grabber (the grabber in ...
customer_reviews.text: Cheap garbage. Spring for a better grabber (the grabber in this kit can’t pick up anything) and skip the clothing tool. The sock putter-onner is fine and the shoe horn is fine. The sponge is basically worthless. If I did it again would buy better quality separates.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle B. Majoros

customer_reviews.title: Useful for hip replacement surgery recovery period
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Dad who just got a hip replaced. Both he and his wife have remarked to me at how useful and helpful this kit has been. Hills wife, who has had multiple surgeries over the years, also mentioned the quality.
customer_reviews.author: CDO

product_meta.title: RMS Hip Kit - Premium 5-Piece Hip Knee Replacement Kit - Ideal for Recovering from Hip Replacement, Knee or Back Surgery, Mobility Tool for Moving and Dressing (32 Inch Reacher)
feature_bullets: 5 PIECES KIT: 1x 32" Reacher, 1x Deluxe Molded Sock Aid with 38" Long Foam Handles, 1x 28" Long Dressing Stick, 1x 22" Long Handle Round Sponge and 1x 24" Long Plastic Shoe Horn.

EXTEND YOUR REACH: Features 32" Long reacher grabber built up with lightweight aluminum with ergonomic handle for comfortable grip. Magnetic tip helps pick up small objects and Fitted with post to assist with dressing. Yellow clip fastens reachers to canes, walkers, wheelchairs and hospital bed rails to keep them nearby.

DRESS INDEPENDENTLY: 28" Dressing Stick with a large vinyl coated "S" Hook to assist with putting on shirts, pulling up pants, skirts, or helping put on shoes or removing socks. Vinyl coated "C" Hook on opposite end for pulling zippers and shoelace loops.
The Sock Aid allows to easily put on socks or stocking without bend over. A 24" long shoe horn is included to easily put on any type of shoe while standing.
BATHING INDEPENDENTLY: A 22" long Bath Sponge making bathing without bending and twisting easier.
